report_title: Online Medical Supplies Sales Industry Report
executive_summary: Figures have been adjusted for inflation and are presented in 2023 currency. Medical supplies are critical for every medical service performed in a healthcare setting or at home. In recent years, rising healthcare utilization, driven by the medical needs of an aging population and broader insurance coverage, has supported robust demand for medical supplies. At the same time, as consumers and businesses perform more services online, browsing and buying medical supplies online has become an attractive option, expanding the size and scope of the industry.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Supply chain snags and supply shortages currently define the medical supply landscape. Early shortages of personal protective equipment and respirators during the initial COVID-19 outbreak were an outcome of under-supply colliding with unprecedented demand. Now, the Russia-Ukraine war and raw material shortages exacerbate preexisting shortages. Supply shortages impede online medical supply companies' ability to provide supplies and strengthen competition as buyers can easily compare stock and prices between companies. Elevated competition and higher operating costs constrain profit growth.

Increasing healthcare utilization in recent years has translated into higher demand for a breadth medical supplies. Heightened insurance coverage has facilitated access to care, supporting higher utilization. As utilization rises, healthcare organizations purchase more medical supplies to meet patient needs.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online Medical Supply Sales Spike During the Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: During the pandemic, access to medical supplies was more crucial than ever. Healthcare organizations needed supplies to treat sick patients, while households sought masks and gloves en masse to stay healthy. An influx of COVID-19 patients at hospitals created unprecedented supply shortages. While an explosion in demand for healthcare supplies heightened the role of medical suppliers in the supply chain, global shortages impeded companies' capacity. Online medical supply sales offered a safe way for healthcare providers and consumers to access what they needed. More consumers and businesses shifted to online shopping and services during the pandemic than ever, supporting the shift from in-person medical supply sales to digital ones.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Supply Chain Shortages Characterize the Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The unprecedented disruption to healthcare in 2020 created massive backlogs of care, renewing healthcare spending between 2021 and 2023. Medical suppliers remain critical to providing variety of medical supplies as patients seek out missed care, but scores of equipment and devices still remain in short supply. Steep inflation affecting the cost of inventory and transportation also challenge online medical suppliers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Online Medical Supply Sales Shift in a Post-COVID Environment
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Recovering patient volumes post-COVID will expand healthcare utilization, increasing demand for wholesale medical supplies. Shortages of medical supplies will persist, with the duration of shortages reliant on broad infrastructure improvements and the global supply chain. A rapidly aging population will translate to a higher rate of high-cost chronic illness, increasing expenditure on medical supplies from healthcare organizations, assisted living facilities and caregivers. Healthcare inflation is expected to be more pronounced in coming years as insurance providers factor in heightened labor costs to premiums. Higher out-of-pocket medical expenses and an inflated cost of living will make buyers more price sensitive when making purchasing decisions.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: An Increasingly Competitive Landscape Will Force Change
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Accelerating healthcare utilization supports demand for medical supplies, expanding the potential size of the downstream market and encouraging new companies to enter the space. Still, new growth opportunities are limited. Procuring medical supplies is a well-established service that buyers are familiar with, so finding new ways to stand out will be challenging. Buyers will have more choices than ever where to purchase medical supplies online. Companies will have to offer customers the best balance of price, user experience, delivery time and customer service to be competitive.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Healthcare Consolidation Could Risk The Business Model
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Consolidation trends occurring in the broader healthcare sector could create changes to online medical supply sales. Major healthcare organizations do purchase supplies from online medical suppliers, but their scope and scale makes online orders not a feasible option for their needs. Medical supply wholesalers offer competitive contracts to healthcare organizations, in addition to broader distribution networks and lucrative value-added services that online medical suppliers can't rival.

industry_definition: This industry includes online retailers of medical supplies, which include equipment and tools used in healthcare for diagnosis, therapy or surgery. Online medical supply companies sell products such as topical treatments and dressings, antiseptics, bandages, cotton, first aid kits, syringes, ice bags, thermometers and heating pads. The industry doesn't include sales of nutritional supplements, vitamins, personal care products, eyeglasses and contact lenses.

negative_impact_factors: low - steady Barriers To Entry Level

key_trends: A rapidly changing healthcare landscape brings in online medical supply sales. More healthcare organizations, businesses and households are purchasing medical supplies online than ever in a post-COVID environment.

Steep competition will challenge online medical suppliers. Delivering downstream buyers the best balance of price, user experience and selection will be critical to stand out as the market becomes saturated.
Medical supplies have a direct impact on public health. The connection to health outcomes in the US exposes suppliers to a high degree of regulatory oversight.

Healthcare providers will be more willing to embrace remote sales moving forward. The jump to online sales during the pandemic will permanently shift buyers' feelings about engaging with online medical suppliers.
More physician practices are procuring medical supplies online than ever. Online medical supply sales allow physicians and clinical staff to access the products they need easily.
Medical instruments are critical to providing patient care. Healthcare organizations and caregivers need inventories of instruments to

market_segmentation.segment: Online Medical Supply Sales Offer an Attractive Option for Physicians
market_segmentation.segment_description: This market includes primary care physicians' offices, dentists and specialists operating as sole practitioners or a part of larger group organizations. Independent practitioners or smaller practices are more likely to purchase medical supplies directly online rather than a major group practice that buys from a wholesaler.

market_segmentation.segment: Hospitals are major buyers of medical supplies
market_segmentation.segment_description: Hospitals are another primary market for online medical supply sales. General medical and surgical hospitals require medical supplies and equipment to provide inpatient, outpatient and emergency care. Major hospitals operate with a scope and scale that make buying from an online medical supplier not financially feasible. Purchasing equipment in bulk from a medical supply distributor where they can negotiate prices and terms. Still, the volume of inventory that hospitals need daily supports online sales of medical supplies.

Consumers shifted to online sales more than ever during the COVID-19 pandemic. Safety concerns led consumers to buy bulk medical supplies like masks, gloves and sanitizers online. While pandemic concerns have subsided, more consumers continue to buy medical supplies online for convenience and cost-savings. High deductibles and out-of-pocket medical expenses leave consumers price-sensitive regarding medical supplies. Online sales allow buyers to compare prices and search for discounts easily. Medical supplies available online can be easier for consumers with an illness, injury or mobility issue to access.

market_segmentation.segment: Downstream Buyers Encompass a Breadth of Healthcare Organizations
market_segmentation.segment_description: The scope of the healthcare sector creates hundreds of downstream buyers for online medical supply sales. Some examples include residential living facilities, substance abuse clinics, outpatient medical centers, surgery centers, medical laboratories and imaging centers.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Surgical and Medical Blood Transfusion and IV Equipment
Surgical and Medical Syringes and Hypodermic Needles
Orthopedic and Prosthetic Appliances and Supplies

tier_1_suppliers: Medical Supplies Wholesaling in the US
Medical Device Manufacturing in the US
Medical Instrument & Supply Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Plastic Products Manufacturing in the US
tier_2_buyers: Healthcare and Social Assistance in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: - Favorable demand by doctors and patients for less invasive, innovative products that improve the quality of patients' lives and disease diagnosis and treatment. - Favorable demographics (i.e. an aging population) and orthopedic hip, knee and spinal implants (devices that use biologics to enhance adhesion of the implants to bone cartilage) have contributed significantly to this growth. - Medical supplies used to manage and monitor chronic diseases are also increasingly being purchased online. - The incidence of type 2 diabetes has risen during the past five years due to rising obesity rates among adults and children. The cost of managing diabetes is high and ordering testing supplies online can reduce costs.

- Patient-monitoring systems are being used more frequently due to a lack of staff and consolidation in the hospital industry. - Hospitals and health maintenance organizations (HMOs) are attempting to lower costs and improve efficiency. - Reduced physician- and nurse-to-patient ratios within critical care units in hospitals are fueling growth for reliable, easy-to-use patient monitoring systems.

business_locations.location: Population Trends Support Demand in the Southeast
business_locations.location_description: The Southeast has the highest concentration of online medical suppliers. This region houses over a quarter of the US population, warranting a greater need for healthcare services. Since medical suppliers are strategically located near population centers and healthcare hubs, the Southeast's population can support more companies. The graph shows the distribution of establishments (online medical suppliers) versus the population across different regions of the US. The Southeast region has the highest percentage of establishments at around 29.2%, while also housing over a quarter (27.1%) of the total US population. This indicates that the Southeast region has a higher concentration of online medical suppliers compared to its population share, likely due to the greater demand for healthcare services in this densely populated region. The graph highlights that suppliers tend to be located near population centers to cater to the healthcare needs of the local population more effectively.

business_locations.location: Close access to downstream markets keeps transportation costs and delivery times short.
business_locations.location_description: Florida has the most medical suppliers in this region. The state's share of adults aged 65 and older supports spending on medical supplies by healthcare providers and consumers.

business_locations.location: CALIFORNIA'S CONSUMPTION OF HEALTHCARE SERVICES TRANSLATES INTO HIGH MEDICAL SUPPLY SALES
business_locations.location_description: While the West's share of establishments aligns with its population share, most medical suppliers in this region are found in California. California is the most populous state in the US, leading to higher consumption of healthcare services. Greater utilization of healthcare services equates to higher demand for medical supplies, supporting this state's share of establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The Food and Drug Administration (FDA) regulates the sale of medical supplies and monitors the safety of all regulated medical products. The FDA also mandates warehousing and transportation protocols, post-market surveillance, recall procedures and advertising regulations.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE CENTERS FOR MEDICARE AND MEDICAID SERVICES
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services (CMS) operates a competitive bidding program for durable medical equipment (DME) and medical supplies. Under the program, wholesalers that work with CMS compete to become Medicare contract suppliers.

Any company supplying medical equipment in the US is subject to durable medical equipment licensing requirements at the state and local levels. Industry-level licenses and tax registrations are necessary to sell medical equipment.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE OCCUPATIONAL SAFETY AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA) sets and enforces health and safety regulations required to ensure the safety of employees in all workplaces.

barriers_points.barrier_description: Ongoing capital requirements exceed labor needs for online medical suppliers.

basis_points.basis_description: Price ultimately determines where consumers order medical supplies online. A saturated market, little differentiation and steep healthcare expenses lead consumers to look for a supplier where they'll spend the least.

How well a medical supplier manages inventory influences competitiveness. Keeping items in stock and delivering them quickly is valuable to consumers and healthcare providers amid ongoing supply shortages.

concentration_points.concentration_description: While many medical supply wholesalers operate in a fragmented landscape, providing products for a specific purpose, online medical suppliers often have more similar products and brands. A lack of differentiation between suppliers lowers their pricing power.
Lower barriers to entry for an online medical supplier make it easier for new companies to join the market.

A competitive market pressures online medical suppliers to offer the best prices to attract consumers. Price competition translates into tighter profit, limiting a company's ability to invest in growth that builds market share.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: TECH ADVANCES KEEP WAGE COSTS TO A MINIMUM
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Leveraging automation and tech advances help minimize labor requirements. Automated warehouses and fulfillment centers can handle the bulk of the work. Fewer customer-facing roles also limit how much an online medical supply retailer allocates toward labor.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: MAINTAINING AN INVENTORY TAKES OVER HALF OF REVENUE
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases are the largest expense for online medical supply retailers, accounting for 63.9% of revenue in 2023. Due to the breadth of medical supplies available, exact purchase costs vary between retailers.

Profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes, accounts for an estimated 5.2% of revenue in 2023. Low barriers to entry combined with an expanding need for medical supplies has incentivized more companies to enter the online medical supply market.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Ongoing capital requirements exceed labor needs
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Ongoing capital requirements exceed labor needs for online medical suppliers.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Every healthcare provider in the US relies on a stable inventory of medical equipment from suppliers to provide critical patient care. Patient volumes fluctuate year-to-year, but online medical suppliers see consistent demand since consumers' health needs aren't tied to economic conditions.

Online medical suppliers benefit from stable patient streams but aren't immune from external events impacting the healthcare sector or consumer behaviors. COVID-19 immediately dropped healthcare utilization for nearly every provider while hospitals pivoted toward treating coronavirus patients, leading sales to sink.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Newly developed high-technology surgical and orthopedic products have consistently helped boost growth in online retailers' shipments of medical devices and equipment. These high-technology products have increased as a percentage of total industry sales due to favorable demand.
Medical devices and drugs are not retailed by this industry. These products experience distinct regulatory standards, are used for different purposes and typically do not require frequent restocking.

FAQs.question: Does your company specialize in one corner of the market or do you retail a diversified range of products?
FAQs.answer: Most online medical supply retailers specialize in one area.

FAQs.question: Are your company's sales heavily dependent on the health of the US economy?
FAQs.answer: When the economy is strong people are better able to purchase medical supplies.

FAQs.question: Does your company contract directly with manufacturers in order to reduce its purchase costs?
FAQs.answer: Some retailers work with manufacturers to reduce costs for both companies.

FAQs.question: Has your company explored acquisition opportunities in order to expand its reach and reduce its overhead expenses?
FAQs.answer: Concentration is low in this industry as most companies have not looked into acquisitions.

FAQs.question: How is your company leveraging new technology in its operations?
FAQs.answer: Some online retailers have utilized digital record keeping software to reduce costs.

FAQs.question: Have you been able to reduce wage costs by automating operations over the past five years?
FAQs.answer: Automation has been limited for online medical supply retailers.

FAQs.question: Have you had any regulatory expenses that have significantly impacted profitability recently?
FAQs.answer: The medical device excise tax posed a threat to industry companies.

FAQs.question: How does your company ensure all health and safety requirements are met?
FAQs.answer: Safety standards are crucial for medical supply retailers.

FAQs.question: How does your company's profit margins compare to your main competitors?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins have been on the rise for most online medical supply retailers.

FAQs.question: How frequently does your company purchase new equipment?
FAQs.answer: Companies must purchase new equipment to stay on the cutting edge.

FAQs.question: What stock control measures does this company use? How do you aim to keep inventory costs to a minimum?
FAQs.answer: Operators need to be able to control stock on hand to ensure that they have an adequate amount of popular items.

FAQs.question: Do you have a good reputation for excellent customer service? What support services do you offer users of your products?
FAQs.answer: It is important to have a loyal customer base to attract repeat buyers and ensure continued sales; this may take some time and will occur through strong before- and after-sales customer service.

FAQs.question: Does the company provide after-sales advice to its customers? What steps can you take to increase the quality of your after-sales service?
FAQs.answer: Operators should provide superior after-sales service, including offering refunds or exchanges and establishing new shopping platforms along with evolving technology.

FAQs.question: How does your company promote health expenditure? How do you take advantage when expenditure is high or adapt when it is low?
FAQs.answer: Total healthcare expenditure includes spending on the health goods and services. When spending climbs, industry sales increase as the medical industry buys more supplies.

FAQs.question: What proportion of your sales are to adults 65 and over?
How do you attract and maintain customers in this age group?
FAQs.answer: People aged 65 and older are heavy consumers of medical services; as people age, they generally require more medical care. As the growth rate of this age demographic increases, demand for medical supplies also rises.

FAQs.question: How do you track trends in the number of physician visits and general health patterns? How do you adapt when the number of visits begins to decrease?
FAQs.answer: When demand for medical services from physicians rises, the stock of medical supplies expands and the rate of replacement increases.
